file_content.text: At last the Republic can rest easy.
The council wants to congratulate you. I'll meet you there.
Cole Cantarus will fly you to battle when you're ready.
We must plan our next move carefully.
I intercepted this message as it was being broadcast across all standard Imperial communications channels.
Fellow Sith. Citizens of the Empire.
Too long the strength of the Empire has been beholden to the in-fighting of the Dark Council and the disappearance of an apathetic Emperor.
Sith, children of Sith and warriors everywhere, I declare a new Empire, open to all who long for conquest, freedom from inhibition and the right to follow their passions.
I suspected he'd betray us, but this is something else....
The Dark Council is dissolved. Those who would join Darth Serevin in supporting me, cast aside your titles and let me lead you to victory.
Those who will not, prepare to face our stealth armada. The Emperor is gone. His station and power are mine. We will conquer the galaxy while the Emperor sleeps.
He had us eliminate his strongest rival so he could seize power for himself.
Malgus staged a coup!
I'll say this for Darth Malgus: He's got charisma.
He knows how to make a speech.
That's what makes him so dangerous. If he unites the surviving Imperial commanders, this war will start up all over again.
Did you really believe Malgus was on our side? I'd hate to think the supreme commander was that gullible.
Can't say I'm surprised.
It's not like we had a choice. Malgus had information we needed to stop Darth Arho. I'd hoped that would buy us a few years of peace.
We're getting chatter from the Imperial comms. Malgus has the stealth technology, the fleet and the Emperor's space station.
I know I've asked too much of you already, but we have to take Darth Malgus out. And soon.
Malgus has revealed his true countenance. And like all servants of the dark side, he must be stopped.
The Jedi live to serve.
Evil never rests, and neither can we.
I defeated the Emperor. There's no way I'll let some want-to-be take his place.
He won't stand a chance.
Don't underestimate him. He wouldn't have made this power play if he didn't have the strength to back it up.
I'm keeping a list of everything I've done to help the Republic. When this is over, I'll send you a bill.
Guess I'll be the hero. Again.
Whatever the cost, you're worth it.
Taking out Darths never gets old.
Looking forward to it, sir!
Then you should enjoy yourself.
The Sith stab each other in the back every chance they get. If we sit back and do nothing, one of his own people will take him out.
Let another Darth do it.
Not right away. You heard the message. Malgus has the support of too many other Sith Lords.
And once he consolidates his position, his stealth armada is sure to challenge the Republic. We have to take him out before that happens.
In case you forgot, I just defeated Darth Arho and saved Ilum. I could use a little downtime to recover.
I was hoping for a vacation.
Time is of the essence. Malgus is gaining support. We have to strike before he can fortify his position.
I must confer with our top military minds. Equip yourself for battle, then hurry to join our meeting. The fate of the galaxy is at stake.
Victory is ours! All Imperials on Ilum have surrendered. But success was costly.
Too many Ongree fell beneath the blades of Arho's Sith troops. Jiyan Dar gave his life battling Arho's Sith troops.
We will mourn Jiyan Dar, and honor his heroic sacrifice.
His death is a great loss.
Every soldier understands he might give his life in service to the Republic, but it is good to know you appreciate the sacrifice Jiyan Dar made.
We knew there would be casualties, and we needed the Ongree to hold off the Sith.
A necessary price to pay.
Jiyan Dar understood this. That is why he held his ground against the Sith, knowing it would cost him his life. Such courage must not be taken for granted.
I guess the Ongree aren't really warriors.
He was weak.
Jiyan Dar gave his life to help you! Now you mock his memory?
You don't deserve to wear a Republic uniform!
You're just a greedy, self-centered opportunist. You know nothing about the honor of service to a higher cause. You disgust me!
You think you're better than the soldiers just because you're a Jedi?
Everyone just calm down. We've been through a lot, but we can't turn against each other.
Commander Rans is right. We must set aside emotion and take rational stock of where we are.
The names of all who gave their lives on Ilum will never be forgotten.
Many soldiers were lost, and many artifacts in the temple were destroyed during the Sullustan bombing runs.
I know as a Jedi you expect no reward, but I want to give you something for your efforts to save the artifacts inside the Jedi Temple.
I want to give you a reward for your heroic efforts to save the artifacts inside the Jedi Temple. The order is forever grateful.
Commander? You read me? Just picked up a transmission from Darth Malgus.
He wanted Darth Arho out of the picture, and we delivered. I wouldn't be shocked if he wants to offer us some kind of reward.
Probably calling to thank us.
Uh... not even close. You better take a listen.
Haven't we done enough for him already?
What does he want now?
I'd say we've done plenty. You better take a listen.
Malgus is dangerous. With Darth Arho out of the picture, it won't be long before he starts looking for a new enemy.
We should take him out next.
Sounds like his search is over. You better take a listen.
Use the tunnel to sneak into the Jedi Temple while we engage the Imperial forces.
Incoming call, Commander. Looks like it's your Imperial friend.
Good to see you alive and well, Supreme Commander. With you back at the helm, Darth Arho's becoming desperate.
He's ordering his ships to land on Ilum's surface, to be equipped with prototype versions of the stealth technology.
The battlefield's not secure. Landing ships here gives us a chance to take out his entire fleet!
He's taking a huge risk.
Only if you know where to find them.
There's no way he pulled up enough resources to equip his fleet before I disabled the deep-miners.
Where'd he get the crystals?
Even with prototypes in only a handful of ships, Arho will have a weapon to lash out at Republic worlds.
I can deal with his ships.
Arho knows someone in the Empire is working against him. He's keeping the location of the landing sites secret.
That is all I can tell you. I won't contact you again. Arho grows suspicious.
Figures. As soon as there's any risk to himself, our "ally" leaves us out in the cold.
Malgus is covering his tracks.
He's a servant of the dark side. Self-preservation will always be his first priority.
If we reveal Darth Malgus is the one who helped us, maybe Arho will focus all his efforts on destroying the traitor.
Let's tell Arho about Malgus.
No. We have to think long-term. If we expose Malgus, we can forget about other Imperials helping the Republic again.
He's giving us an impossible mission. We don't have the resources to defend an entire planet. Arho's ships could land anywhere!
Malgus wants us to fail.
There's only a few spots on Ilum where a ship larger than a shuttle could even attempt to touch down.
We just have to take out those landing strips. If we can disable the ships already on the ground, nobody else will be able to land.
Look, we all know who's going to end up doing this. I'm used to it by now.
By "we" you mean "me," right?
Look, we all know who's going to end up doing this. Ever since we landed, it's been one impossible mission after another. It's getting a little old.
By "we" you mean "us," right?
From those who give the most, the most is always asked.
Wise words, Master Boudyn.
Very true.
I hope they will give you comfort in the difficult time ahead.
Arguing with you is just going to give me a headache, isn't it?
Yeah. That makes no sense.
Just tell me what to do.
Fine. I get it.
Fine. I get it.
Havoc Squad is ready, Commander.
Just give the order, sir.
Our team is ready, Commander.
Just give the order, sir.
I came here to stop Darth Arho. Might as well let me finish the job.
No point sending anyone else.
We came here to stop Darth Arho. Might as well let us finish the job.
No point sending anyone else.
I'd send someone else if I could. But Caroowar and Jiyan Dar are leading all available troops against key Imperial installations.
Caroowar and Jiyan Dar are missing. I'm guessing they're leading troops against key Imperial targets. That means this mission is up to me.
I'll help you however I can.
Caroowar and Jiyan Dar are missing. I'm guessing they're leading troops against key Imperial targets. That means this mission is up to us.
We'll help you however we can.
A very astute--and accurate--observation. I don't have anyone else to spare.
Do you know what the temperature is out there? I've got frostbite on my... somewhere you really don't want to get frostbite.
Back to freezing our... toes.
I know this has been hard, but Caroowar and Jiyan Dar are already leading troops against key Imperial installations. I can't afford to send anyone else.
This sounds like a mission the regular troops can handle.
Send somebody else.
I don't have any troops to spare. Caroowar and Jiyan are already leading our soldiers against key Imperial targets. It has to be you.
I'll give you the location of the landing strips. Use these ion grenades against the ships already on the ground.
You made it back alive.
Only because of you. I'm running out of ways to say thanks.
I'm just glad we got you back, Commander.
Just following orders, sir.
Havoc Squad really went above and beyond this time, Major. I won't forget it.
Your team really went above and beyond, Major. I won't forget it.
We're on the same side, Commander. I know you'd have done the same for me.
No thanks necessary.
I know we'd try. But nobody else can do what you do. So do us all a favor and try not to get captured.
Plenty of ways to show your appreciation. Credits. Ship upgrades. A blanket pardon from the Senate I can hang onto, just in case.
We'll think of something.
I'll look into it. Until then, you'll have to make do with my gratitude.
My order is sworn to defend the Republic, Commander. We will always be here when you need us.
The Jedi live to serve.
I just wish we didn't need you so often. But Dark Lords are usually more than my troops can handle.
Did the rest of the Republic prisoners make it back?
Where are the other POWs?
Every last one of them. Our medics are looking them over; some of them were in pretty bad shape.
You're a key military asset. The Republic needs your expertise. Ilum won't be the last time we battle with the Empire.
You're too valuable to lose.
You're right, unfortunately. They're down now, but they always seem to rise again.
I owe you my life. We all do.
The things those monsters did to us....
Arho knows we're here. He's going to send reinforcements.
We have to get moving.
You're right... I can hear them coming down the hall!
They can't hurt you anymore.
You're safe now.
They've done enough already. Wait... what was that?
Whatever doesn't kill you makes you stronger.
You're alive. That's enough.
Easy for you to say. You can't even imagine... wait! What was that?
Someone coming down the hall. Arho must have sent reinforcements!
We have no armor. No weapons. You have to hold them off and give us a chance to escape.
We'll meet you back at the Republic command post. Good luck, and thank you.
Good. You're here. We're going to need your help--all of you--if we're going to defeat the enemy.
Good. You're here. As you can see, we need all the help we can get.
Let me introduce our allies: Master Boudyn of the Jedi and Commanders Caroowar, Jiyan Dar and Yet Jub.
The introductions are over. Now we strike back! Retake the temple--no more retreating like cowards!
No, Caroowar. The attack on the temple is to distract us from Darth Arho's true goal... just as the peace talks blinded us before the Sacking of Coruscant.
Darth Arho's a Sith. Seizing the temple is a direct challenge to our honor. He's throwing it in our face!
He insulted our entire order!
We must not rise to his bait. There is no emotion, there is peace. Let Supreme Commander Rans do his job.
There are still secrets in the temple worth guarding, Commander.
Are the temple's secrets safe?
I sealed the archives in the temple's vault during the attack. It would take them days to cut their way through the durasteel doors.
Arho's not here for the archives; he wants Ilum's crystals. They're using deep-miners to drill into the very core of the planet!
Commander Caroowar has a point. We should go after Darth Arho, first. Without their leader, the Imperials won't stand a chance.
The Wookiee's right, sir!
You have to look at the big picture, Major. Ilum's crystals should be our focus. The Imperials are using deep-miners to drill into the planet's core!
I like you Republic folks, but it always seems like you're two steps behind the Empire with your plans.
Those Imperials are crafty.
Which is why we can't fall prey to their tricks. The Imperials want Ilum's crystals. They're using deep-miners to drill into the planet's core!
If we don't hit them at the temple, then where do we strike?
What's the plan, Commander?
I like to learn from my mistakes. You should try it sometime.
The Imperials want Ilum's crystals. They're using deep-miners to drill into the planet's core!
The excavations leave massive sink holes. The entire world's becoming unstable. If we don't stop them, Ilum could literally crack in two.
We'll engage the bulk of the Imperial forces while you go to the excavation sites and disable the deep-miners.
After you've cleared each mine, call us and we'll send reinforcements in to hold the area.
This is the kind of mission we live for, Commander.
You can count on Havoc Squad.
Will do.
This base doesn't seem very secure. Maybe you and the other commanders should retreat to one of the ships in orbit.
Will you be safe here?
We can't do that. The best place to oversee the efforts of our troops is right here on the surface. We're staying.
I was afraid my days of battling the Imperials were over.
I'm going to enjoy this!
Stopping the deep-miners won't end this. Unless we locate the Imperial command post, they'll figure out another way to harvest Ilum's crystals.
Each mine must have a communications terminal to receive orders. We could locate the Imperial command center using data from the outgoing transmissions.
Good idea. After you disable each deep-miner, download the mine's terminal datalog. Bring all the data to Agent Samm Bradber at the communications center for analysis.
The fate of Ilum is in your hands. May the Force be with you.
We can't rest until the Empire is driven off Ilum for good.
The Imperials are taking heavy losses. Caroowar has broken their front lines, and Jiyan Dar has caved in their flank.
The Sith are inflicting heavy casualties on the Ongree regiments, but Jiyan Dar refuses to fall back!
The Imperials are in full retreat! Republic troops are storming the temple. We have to find Darth Arho before he escapes!
I've secured the first excavation site and scanned the communications terminal.
Well done. We'll send a team to secure the mine while you head to the next one.
I'm at the last mine. Everything's all clear.
Get that transmission data to Samm Bradber. He's waiting for you at the Republic communications center.
You'd better take cover, sir. We can run for base camp once they're gone. Good luck.
I'm not afraid of Malgus.
My forces will secure the Jedi Temple and make certain every Imperial soldier inside is sent packing.
The Wookiees will join the Ongree in securing the Temple. The Imperials will run screaming from Ilum!
Now you're being stupid.
